reviews.review: a great way to spend the time at the theater
Excellent, seriously way better than the first two Avengers movie. I can't wait for the next. They somehow made Thanos a likeable, fascinating villain.

This film was too long. So boring, nothing special, too much save the world talk. It was a pointless movie. They should buy a thesaurus and substitute overused words for something else. Just so it's not the same thing in the same way and in the same order being said.
Boring for the most part except for the scenes with Iron Man and Spider Man.
It was quite boring most of the time. The end was the only really interesting thing about the movie.

i cannot speak highly enough of this film.
the culmination of ten years of a cinimatic univerce in any franchise in one film is very hard to deliver but the russo brothers delivered amazingly.this action packed film blew the roof off anything I could've thought'd happen.not only did it include emotional and bitter sweet moments to the characters weve grown to love but also managed to make me sympathise with the mad titan.
new favorite filme

Loved every single second of this movie. Seeing all these characters I've been watching for 10 years come together; made me feel excited over and over again. No one character gets a tremendous amount of screen time. Marvel tried hard to split it all up evenly. Because of this, the only area it suffers is that it cuts around a lot and feels rushed, (which is essential to tell its story and showcase all of its characters). Without getting into spoilers, the movie is funny, emotional, nostalgic yet fresh, and a whole lot of fun because of the unique team-ups. I felt giddy quite often throughout the movie. I am super excited to watch the conclusion of this story in the future!

Avengers Infinity War has too many prerequisite movies for the viewers to understand and comprehend all the Avengers that show up, and all in all is just another Disney propaganda machine aimed to glamorize war, glorify technology and gun rights, military spending and tries mesmerizing the audience with colors as though they still have infantile minds using the 6 rainbow colors as the Infinity Stones so that the audience is lulled into fearing a purple guy by having him possess all 6 colors of the rainbow. I also don't get the "Squidward" insult at Ebony, first off he has NO NOSE and second, he looks a lot more like Voldemort.

This is a superhero genre masterpiece that will stand the test of time and go down as a turning point in cinema history. The amount of talent between everyone on and off screen is incredible. The Russo brothers have done it yet again following up two of their other Marvel films (Winter Soldier and Civil War). Josh Brolin delivers the stand out performance as the mad titan Thanos who is has an intimidating presence on and off the screen.
best superhero movie of all  time hands down????????????
